title: Adaptive Social Studies Design Workshop Using Distributed Learning Object Economies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design theory and understanding of learning object concepts
context.additional_context: Participants engage in projects reflecting real corporate social studies job scenarios, conducting blended learning with collaboration tools (ZOOM, Miro, Google Workspace, etc.) in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Independently extract three or more social studies-related learning objects using the microcontext-based search tool (LORSE) from the Distributed Learning Object Repository (DLOR).
Apply the LOOK process to place extracted learning objects into enterprise-tailored adaptive learning designs.
Achieve over 80% effectiveness (accessibility, reusability, adaptability) in designed learning modules through peer feedback and rubric assessments.

resources: Corporate Social Studies Curriculum Standard Metadata Template

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
